title: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure: Building capacities for the use of big data algorithm systems (BDAS) in early crisis detection
analysis_techniques: Document analysis; Semi-structured interviews; Thematic analysis
research_description: The study examines how BDAS are used in early crisis detection within the German Federal Government, particularly focusing on the Federal Foreign Office and Federal Ministry of Defence. It explores the role of institutional environments in capacity-building strategies.
research_results: Results indicate that institutional structures affect capacity-building at multiple levels, with the Ministry of Defence relying on subordinate agencies and the Foreign Office leveraging external networks.
future_research: Future research should address the integration of BDAS across broader public sector organizations and explore the role of big data in other policymaking contexts.
